history.content: CS61x and CS70 typically expand to take everybody into the class (about 700-2k students each semester per class). EE16 does have some reserved seats for junior transfer I believe. You can declare CS as long as you have a 3.3, there could be limitations such as proof that you can graduate on time but mostly the gpa cap and lower div prereqs are the determining factors.

I will be a transfer student in L&S in the fall semester.  I have already officially declared another major, but would actually like to give CS a shot, so I don't know if I would be classified as "Recent L&S transfer student" or "All other registered UC Berkeley Students: other declared majors" here on the "Getting into CS classes" website https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy .

In addition, how hard is it getting into the prereqs like CS61 series, CS70, and EECS 16 series without any priority should I not be classified as "Recent L&S transfer student"? Would I be able to declare/switch to CS assuming successful completion of prereqs with the 3.3 GPA if I do so by the end of my junior year at Berkeley, even though I have already declared another major?

Thank you.
history.subject: New Transfer: Course Priority and Schedule Questions
